location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: ‘Secret Letters received, by way of Marseilles, July 16 1855’

mods.abstract: This bundle consists of summaries, and partial transcripts, of secret letters received from both the President in Council (2 June 1855, Numbers 33-35) and the Government of Bombay (9 June 1855, Numbers 43-45). The amount of detail for each entry therefore varies.The letters from the President in Council (folios 13-15r) consist of updates on Afghanistan, Punjab, the progress of the Nepalese army against Thibet [Tibet], and the dispute between Gulab Singh (Maharaja of Cashmere [Kashmir]) and his nephew Raja Jowahir Singh.The section from Bombay (folio 15v) contains only very brief updates on Aden, Turkish Arabia, and Persia.

name.namePart: President and Governor of Bombay in Council
